zone.line: every
Our feet now, each cal palm,
Are sandalled with calm ,
And the dew of our wings is a rain of balm;
And beyond our eyes
The human love lies
Which makes all it gazes on, Paradise.
Chorus of Spirits & Hours
Then weave the web of the mystic measure;
Of music & dance & shapes of light
From the depths of the sky & the ends of the Earth
Come, swift Spirits of might & of pleasure,
Fill the dance & the music of mirth,
As the waves of a thousand streams rush
by
To an Ocean of splendour & harmony!
Chorus of Spirits
Our spoil is won
Our task is done
We are free to dive or soar or run {. . .}
Beyond or around
Or within the bound
Which clips the world with darkness round
